tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE WeatherData (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  location VARCHAR(255),
  temperature FLOAT,
  humidity FLOAT,
  wind_speed FLOAT,
  rainfall FLOAT,
  date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE weather_data (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    pressure FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE weather_stations (
    station_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    station_name VARCHAR(50),
    location VARCHAR(100),
    longitude FLOAT,
    latitude FLOAT
);

CREATE TABLE weather_measurements (
    measurement_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    station_id INT,
    measurement_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT,
    air_pressure FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (station_id) REFERENCES weather_stations(station_id)
);

CREATE TABLE sensor_data (
    sensor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    measurement_id INT,
    sensor_type VARCHAR(50),
    reading FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (measurement_id) REFERENCES weather_measurements(measurement_id)
);

CREATE TABLE weather_alerts (
    alert_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    station_id INT,
    alert_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    alert_type VARCHAR(50),
    alert_message TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (station_id) REFERENCES weather_stations(station_id)
);

CREATE TABLE WeatherData (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    temperature FLOAT,
    humidity FLOAT
)

CREATE TABLE WeatherStation (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location TEXT,
    altitude INT
)

CREATE TABLE SensorDevice (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    serial_number TEXT,
    model TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE WeatherObservation (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    weather_data_id INT,
    weather_station_id INT,
    sensor_device_id INT,
    observation TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (weather_data_id) REFERENCES WeatherData(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (weather_station_id) REFERENCES WeatherStation(id),
    FOREIGN KEY (sensor_device_id) REFERENCES SensorDevice(id)
)

CREATE TABLE WeatherAnalysis (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    observation_id INT,
    analysis_result TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (observation_id) REFERENCES WeatherObservation(id)
)
